  • Burview Hall

Burview Hall

The building has a large hall with kitchen, a games room and two sensory rooms providing sensory tactile areas. These are particularly beneficial for children and adults with profound learning disabilities. They can be hired on an hourly basis by groups, schools or individuals, providing a benefit to those with a learning or other disability.
MAKE AN ENQUIRY

Facilities at Burview Hall

  • The Sensory room

    Our new sensory garden is now open!

    Our larger sensory room has a milky way wall hanging carpet; bubble tubes; soft seating; music; light wheels, fibre optics and soft day bed. The room is available for hire for adults and children with learning disabilities. It is wheelchair accessible and has a hoist
  • OASIS room

    Take a look behind the scenes of our Nova Club

    Feautring a milky way wall hanging carpet that creates a shimmering effect of continually changing colours; bubble tubes; soft seating; music; light wheels and fibre optics. The room is available for hire for adults with learning disabilities and those with dementia or stroke patients. A maximum of 6 people can be accommodated in the room.
  • A stimulating outside area to explore

    Sensory garden

    Our new safe and secure sensory garden is in an area of our woodlood. It is a place to stimulate the senses calmly and gently; using plants, layout, and specialist equipment to engage the senses of sight, sound, smell, tocuh and taste. The sensory garden has been specially designed for children and adults with learning disabilities and is a wonderful inclusive environment for all.
  • A fun place to socialise

    Games room

    The games room contains pool and snooker tables, table football, table tennis and darts.
  • Large hall

    Our new sensory garden is now open!

    The hall can accommodate approximately 100 people and is large enough for sports training. It contains various sports equipment including indoor bowling. It also has disco lights, stage lighting, an interactive floor and OMi-Beam equipment (unique audiovisual interactive lighting system). Tables and chairs are provided. A modern cinema system with loop induction has been installed.
  • Tagline

    Kitchen

    Some informtion about the kitchen and what is there ...

Access Requirements

The building is on one level and is fully accessible, with assisted showers for special care users and disabled toilets. There is a car park at the front of the building, with disabled parking spaces.
View on AccessAble

MAKE AN ENQUIRY
Walton on Thames Charity built Burview Hall, replacing an old run-down building which was demolished in 1999. Although they retain ownership of the hall, Elmbridge Mencap is responsible for all the running costs and initially provided funds for its refurbishment. Any repairs and purchase of new equipment are provided by Elmbridge Mencap through membership fees, hall hire payments and fundraising activities.
We help enrich the lives of all people with learning disabilities.
Get in touch
  • Burview Hall, Queens Road, Walton-on-Thames, Surrey KT12 5AB
